articles.author: Stephen Nellis
articles.description: Apple (AAPL.O) on Monday introduced new MacBook Pro computers and three new chips that will power its laptops and desktops, and the company said it had redesigned its graphics processing units (GPU), a key part of the chip where Nvidia dominates the market.
articles.title: Apple introduces new MacBook Pro and M3 chip family

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's manufacturing activity unexpectedly returned to contraction in October, an official factory survey showed on Tuesday, casting a cloud over recent indicators that showed a nascent recovery in the world's second-largest economy.
articles.title: China factory activity returns to contraction in Oct

articles.author: David Shepardson, Joseph White
articles.description: General Motors (GM.N) and the United Auto Workers (UAW) struck a tentative deal on Monday, ending the union's unprecedented six-week campaign of coordinated strikes that won record pay increases for workers at the Detroit Three automakers.
articles.title: UAW reaches deal with GM, ending strike against Detroit automakers

articles.author: Jamie McGeever
articles.description: A look at the day ahead in Asian markets from Jamie McGeever, financial markets columnist.
articles.title: Morning Bid: All eyes on Bank of Japan's 1% yield cap

articles.author: Leika Kihara
articles.description: The Bank of Japan will likely revise up its inflation forecasts and discuss further tweaks to its bond yield control at its policy meeting on Tuesday, amid growing expectations the days of the controversial monetary tool are numbered.
articles.title: BOJ likely to lift inflation forecasts, debate yield control's future

articles.author: Joyce Lee, Heekyong Yang
articles.description: Samsung Electronics (005930.KS) on Tuesday flagged a gradual recovery in demand in 2024 after reporting its highest quarterly profit so far this year, as the battered memory chip market began showing signs of a rebound from a severe downturn.
articles.title: Samsung says chips to recover in 2024 after best quarterly profit this year

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Jody Godoy
articles.description: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried testified on Monday that he believed his Alameda Research hedge fund had enough assets to cover an $8 billion debt to the cryptocurrency exchange until days before both collapsed.
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried testifies he thought hedge fund could cover $8 billion debt to FTX

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: Hamas said its militants fired machine guns and anti-tank missiles toward Israeli forces in north and south Gaza early on Tuesday as Israel's tanks and infantry attacked the enclave's main city, raising concerns about the plight of Palestinian civilians.
articles.title: Hamas says it fires on Israeli troops pressing Gaza ground assault

articles.author: Raphael Satter, Katie Paul, Sheila Dang
articles.description: Maria Julia Cassis was sitting down to a meal in her terraced home in north London when her 6-year-old son ran into the dining room, his face pale.
articles.title: Graphic pro-Israel ads make their way into children’s video games

articles.author: Mayela Armas, Vivian Sequera
articles.description: Venezuela's Supreme Justice Tribunal said on Monday it has suspended the results of an opposition presidential primary that took place this month, despite an electoral deal between the government and the opposition that allows each side to choose its candidate.
articles.title: Venezuela's top court suspends results of opposition presidential primary
